item.title:
Web Awards 2005
The judges scores are in and the ...
item.description:
Web Awards 2005

The judges scores are in and the short list of finalists for each category has
been uploaded onto the Web Awards site and is now ready for voting. Anyone can
vote for their favourite short listed Brighton & Hove web site. The winners
will be announced at the Awards ceremony at Fabrika on 10th November.

Voting closes on the 8th November vote for your favourite site now
item.author: blog@janeandrichard.co.uk (Jane)

item.title: Its that time of year again - Brighton and Hove We...
item.description:
Its that time of year again - Brighton and Hove Web Awards. Last year, 2 Brighton Bloggers won awards - Best Personal Sites and Weblogs went to Assistant and the Humanity Accesibility Award went to Adactio (our designer here at BrightonBloggers).

The categories this year are Best Local Arts and Music Site, Best Business Site, Best Sites for Nights Out, Best Community Site and Best Personal Sites and Weblogs. You can nominate your site or any other for that matter.

Additionally, judges are needed to help judge the awards - want to volunteer?
item.author: blog@janeandrichard.co.uk (Jane)

item.title: Quite a few new additions this time - Yandleblog, ...
item.description:

Also Nicky P's Blog of Metal which is the blog of an ex-Brighton resident coming to terms with live outside of Brighton.
